other_tests.findings: Liver does not show biliary dilatation or textural abnormality. A rounded hypoechoic lesion in the periphery of the right hepatic lobe measuring approximately 1.4 cm may represent a hemangioma. The pancreas is unremarkable. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation. CBD measures up to 4 mm. Multiple large shadowing stones within the gallbladder, which is mildly distended. There is also mild wall thickening and wall edema of the gallbladder. No pericholecystic fluid. Portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow.
